part2.question:
Describe a shopping mall you often visit. You should say:
Where it is
Who you usually go with
What you do there
And explain why you like going to this mall so often.
part2.model_answer: I frequently visit the Grand Plaza Mall, which is the most Bustling [熙熙攘攘的] shopping center in my city. It has hundreds of stores that are very Trendy [时髦的] and popular with young people. Since the prices are usually Affordable [负担得起的] during sales, I often go there to Shop till you drop [疯狂购物] on weekends. It is extremely Convenient [方便的] because it is connected to the subway station. However, it can get Overcrowded [拥挤的] on holidays. I sometimes just go Window shopping [只逛不买] when I have no money. It is a great place to hang out with friends. I am a Bargain hunter [专门买便宜货的人] there.

part2.question:
Describe a traditional street market you enjoy visiting. You should say:
Where it is located
What kinds of things they sell
How the atmosphere differs from a mall
And explain why you like shopping there.
part2.model_answer: I really enjoy going to the Old Town Night Market, which is famous for its lively atmosphere [气氛]. It is always Bustling [熙熙攘攘的] with tourists and locals looking for snacks. Although it is Overcrowded [拥挤的], I love it because the street food is delicious and Affordable [负担得起的] for students. You can find many Trendy [时髦的] accessories there too. It is more interesting than just Window shopping [只逛不买] in a mall. I am a Bargain hunter [专门买便宜货的人] and often haggle for lower prices. It is a Convenient [方便的] place to eat dinner after class. The vendors are very friendly and energetic. It is a unique cultural experience that represents our city's spirit.

part2.question:
Describe a shop that you recently recommended to a friend. You should say:
What the shop sells
Where it is
Why you recommended it
And explain what makes this shop special.
part2.model_answer: I recently recommended a vintage clothing store called 'Retro Style' to my best friend. It sells unique clothes that are very Trendy [时髦的] right now. Provided that you are a Bargain hunter [专门买便宜货的人], you can find amazing deals that are highly Affordable [负担得起的]. The shop assistant is very Charismatic [有魅力的] and helpful. It is never Overcrowded [拥挤的], so shopping there is relaxing. It is a Convenient [方便的] location near our university. We went there to Shop till you drop [疯狂购物] last Saturday. The brand is becoming very Influential [有影响力的] locally. It was a great find because the quality is excellent and the style is perfect for her.

part3.question: Some people believe building shopping malls isn't a good thing, what do you think?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] From my perspective [视角], malls promote excessive Consumerism [消费主义] which can be harmful to our local communities. [Reason] They encourage people to buy things they don't really need, leading to significant waste and financial debt for many families. [Example] While they create jobs, they also destroy small local businesses by dominating the Retail [零售] market completely. For example, many mom-and-pop shops have closed because they cannot compete with the big mall.

part3.question: Why do people enjoy going to malls?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] It is obvious that malls offer convenience and entertainment in one comfortable place for families. [Reason] People can shop, eat, and watch movies without leaving the building, which is perfect for weekends or rainy days. [Example] Since Retail therapy [购物疗法] makes people happy, they go to malls to relax and spend money freely. Many people find walking around the clean, bright halls very relaxing after a long week of work.

part3.question: How did people pay in the past, and how do they pay now?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Historically, people used physical cash or gold coins for every single Transaction [交易] they made in daily life. [Reason] Now, digital payments via smartphones are replacing paper notes rapidly because they are much more efficient and hygienic for everyone. [Example] Whereas cash is slow, scanning a code is instant and secure for the modern E-commerce [电子商务] user. For instance, in China, almost no one carries a wallet anymore because WeChat Pay is ubiquitous.

part3.question: What are the downsides of mobile payments?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] To be honest, they pose a significant risk to user Privacy [隐私] and financial security if not managed well. [Reason] If your phone is hacked or stolen, thieves can access your funds immediately without needing a physical card or PIN. [Example] Unless you have strong passwords, Impulsive [冲动的] hackers [黑客] can empty your bank account and make you Break the bank [倾家荡产]. Also, companies track your spending habits to sell your data to advertisers.

part3.question: Has the rise of e-commerce caused the death of local small businesses?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Regrettably, yes, the dominance of online Retail [零售] is slowly killing small mom-and-pop shops in our neighborhoods. [Reason] They simply cannot compete with the Reputation [声誉], huge inventory, and low prices of global giants like Amazon or Alibaba. [Example] If we don't support them intentionally, traditional stores will vanish from our streets forever, leaving ghost towns. It is sad to see empty storefronts where vibrant businesses used to be.

part3.question: Is consumerism beneficial or harmful to society?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] In my view, it is largely harmful because it fuels Impulsive [冲动的] desires for material goods we don't need. [Reason] People start to judge others by their Transaction [交易] history rather than their character or kindness, which creates social division. [Example] Although shopping feels good briefly, true happiness does not come from material items that Catch one's eye [吸引眼球] in a store. We should value experiences and relationships more than possessions.
